channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Netherlands expands export curbs on chip tools with more ASML equipment impacted
item.description: The Netherlands said it is expanding export restrictions on advanced semiconductor manufacturing equipment, bringing more of ASML's machines under curbs.

item.title: Nobel winner Joseph Stiglitz says Fed raised rates ‘too far, too fast’ — and now needs to cut big
item.description: Nobel Prize-winning economist Joseph Stiglitz believes the Federal Reserve should deliver a half-point interest rate cut at its forthcoming meeting

item.title: Once the envy of the world, Germany's car brands now weigh heavily on its struggling economy
item.description: Germany’s car industry was once recognized around the world for its high-quality, innovative combustion engine cars. But where is the sector now?

item.title: Director of Disney's Lion King says AI is a 'Wild West,' echoes how animation changed film
item.description: Artificial intelligence is a "Wild West" with "very few rules" — but it has the potential to democratize the film industry in the long term, says Rob Minkoff.

item.title: The Fed won't 'push the panic button' and go for a jumbo rate cut, economist says
item.description: As investors await the upcoming rate decision by the Fed this month, Carl Weinberg of High Frequency Economics said that a deep interest rate cut was unlikely.

item.title: China should focus on fighting deflationary pressure, former central bank governor says
item.description: China's policymakers need to focus on boosting domestic demand, Yi Gang, former head of the People's Bank of China, said Friday at the Bund Summit in Shanghai.

item.title: World swelters through its hottest summer on record for the second year running
item.description: The summer of 2024 was the hottest in history, according to the European Union's climate monitor.

item.title: U.S. rolls out new chip-related export controls as China makes industry advances
item.description: The restrictions cover critical technologies, including quantum computing and semiconductor goods, and is aimed at China and other competitors.

item.title: 'Economic refugees' flee from New Zealand as cost-of-living crisis deepens
item.description: The economy is going to "get worse before it gets better," said Shamubeel Eaqub, principal economist at the New Zealand Institute of Economic Research.

item.title: I reached financial freedom at the age of 38: Here are 4 money principles I live by
item.description: Today, Shao Chun, 38, lives off of his seven-figure investment portfolio. Here are four money-related rules that he follows.

item.title: India and Singapore agree to cooperate on chips as countries seek to strengthen partnership
item.description: "Singapore is not just a partner, it is an inspiration for every developing country. We want to create a bunch of Singapores in India," Modi said in a meeting with Wong.

item.title: 7-Eleven's parent company rejects $38.6 billion takeover bid, says offer 'grossly undervalues' company
item.description: Even if the offer was raised "very significantly," Seven & i said the bid does not consider the "multiple and significant challenges" it would face.

item.title: Japanese chip equipment firms count on China sales amid U.S. moves to block high-end exports to Beijing
item.description: Japanese chip equipment providers are increasingly counting on China as their largest source of revenue despite looming U.S. export control pressure.

item.title: China's wealthy are increasingly looking overseas for business investment opportunities
item.description: China's wealthy want to pursue business opportunities abroad, rather than just investment returns, according to asset managers and consultants.

item.title: Friday's jobs report for August is going to be huge. Here's what to expect
item.description: The Wall Street consensus is for nonfarm payrolls growth of 161,000 for August and a slight decline in the unemployment rate to 4.2%.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Stocks had a record-breaking rally. What's next?
item.description: After a record-breaking 14-day rally, analyst fear risks are rising from the stock market's own success.

item.title: Honor steps up challenge to Samsung with launch of thin foldable phone
item.description: Honor is ramping up its challenge to Samsung in the fast-growing foldable smartphone market.

item.title: OPEC+ members delay plans to hike production by two months after oil price slump
item.description: The increases were part of a plan to gradually return a broader 2.2 million barrels per day of supply to the market over the following months.

item.title: JPMorgan top economist says the Fed should cut rates by a half point this month
item.description: JPMorgan chief U.S. economist Michael Feroli believes there is a strong case for the Federal Reserve to speed up the pace of rate cuts.

item.title: Former EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier named new French prime minister
item.description: Macron charged Barnier with forming a government on Thursday, according to an announcement shared by the Elysee Palace.

item.title: These are the top 10 MBA programs in the world in 2024, according to LinkedIn
item.description: Stanford University tops LinkedIn's list as the No.1 MBA program in the world in 2024.

item.title: A supersized Fed rate cut this month could be 'very dangerous' for markets, economist warns
item.description: A deeper interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve this month could spook financial markets, according to one economist.

item.title: Hunter Biden pleads guilty in tax case, hours after jury selection for trial was to begin
item.description: Hunter Biden, the son of U.S. President Joe Biden, was convicted in June of crimes related to buying a handgun while using crack cocaine.

item.title: Volvo Cars cuts margin and revenue aims after ditching 2030 electric vehicle target
item.description: The Swedish automaker is trimming its earnings margin goal for 2026 due to "increased complexity especially in relation to global trade and tariffs."

item.title: Tesla says it will launch Full Self Driving product in Europe and China early next year
item.description: Tesla says it will launch its "Full Self Driving" driver assistance product in Europe and China early next year.

item.title: AstraZeneca says staff detained in China amid reports of a drug-import investigation
item.description: Some employees of British pharmaceutical giant AstraZeneca have been detained by police in China as part of an investigation, the company confirmed Thursday.

item.title: Visa debuts a new product designed to make it safer to pay directly from your bank account
item.description: Visa said it plans to launch a dedicated service for bank transfers, skipping credit cards and the traditional direct debit process.

item.title: Saudi Arabia's fiscal breakeven oil price is rising fast. What will the kingdom do about it?
item.description: Saudi Arabia's fiscal deficit is growing as the kingdom embarks on huge spending projects as part of Vision 2030.

item.title: London landlords sell up properties at record rates ahead of anticipated tax hikes
item.description: London landlords are selling up their buy-to-let properties at record rates as anticipated tax hikes add further pressure to the once lucrative investment sector.

item.title: Qualcomm says it's working on mixed reality smart glasses with Samsung and Google
item.description: Google, Samsung and Qualcomm's smart glasses would be a different approach from Apple's Vision Pro.
